data.scheme_name: Existing - 115BAB: Corporate Tax Rate For New Manufacturing Companies
data.benefits: This section provides new effective tax rate, which will apply to domestic companies availing the benefit of 115BAB is 17.16%.
data.eligibility: All NEW domestic manufacturing companies engaged in the business of manufacture or production of any article or thing, and research in relation to such article or thing are eligible under this section.
data.conditions:
1. The company has been set up and registered on or after 1 October 2019 and has commenced manufacturing on or before 31 March 2024. 
  2. Not be formed by the splitting up and reconstruction of a business already in existence. 
  3. Second hand plant and machinery cannot be used for any purpose. 
  4. The company can use plant and machinery used outside India and used in India for the first time. 
  5. Can not use a building previously used as a hotel or a convention centre.
data.beneficiaries:
1. Applicable to domestic companies incorporated between October 1, 2019 and March 31, 2024 

2. Must be engaged in the business of manufacturing, production, or research and development of an article or thing, or generation of electricity.
data.prerequisites:
1. Commencement Deadline: Manufacturing or production must begin on or before March 31, 2024. 

2. Exclusions: - Cannot claim deductions under Chapter VI-A (except Section 80JJAA). - Cannot claim additional depreciation under Section 32. 

3. Restrictions: - The business must not involve certain activities such as software development, mining, or construction, among others.
data.description:
1. This section provides new effective tax rate, which will apply to domestic companies availing the benefit of 115BAB is 17.16%. 
  2. The base tax rate is 15% Surcharge applicable is 10% Cess is 4% Such companies will not be required to pay MAT (minimum alternative tax) under section 115JB of the act.
data.how_to_apply: The company has to exercise the option on or before the due date of filing income tax returns which is usually 30th September of the assessment year, unless extended. Once the company opts for this section in a financial year, it cannot be withdrawn in subsequent assessment years.
data.funding_mechanism: A new manufacturing company can exercise the option to be taxed under section 115BAB.
